data.title: 20+ friends gathered here and had a great time.
data.text: I am a beer geek. I attended the Lake O Lakes District Barbershop contest/convention in Appleton and over 20 of us gathered at the Appleton Beer Factory.  I called ahead of time (1 day) and they told me that a group that size can bog down the kitchen and offered to set up a buffet for me.  I declined because I did not discuss it with my group. While some of us waited longer than normal for our order, I cannot say I was not warned. Many staff members worked hard to get the orders out.  We passed the time singing barbershop harmony. Our server, Mandy, and the entire crew were wonderful. Beer was great and I did not hear one complaint about the quality or price of the food from my friends.  We would do it again and perhaps explore the buffet options.

data.title: HORRIBLE
data.text: AWFUL, TERRIBLE, GHASTLY, HIDEOUS, HORRIFIC and any other words that describe horrible.  The service was horrible the food was horrible, the drinks were horrible.  A group of us (12 people) went there to celebrate a friend's birthday.  There was another group a little larger than ours there at the same time.  The place was virtually empty except for our two groups. Their soda wasn't working correctly and instead of trying to fix it - the bartender's response to those of us that don't drink beer - "You know we're a beer joint, right?". When it came time to be seated, the place is huge and they chose to put both groups right next to each other - not even enough room for the wait staff to get between the two tables.    Some of the food was good, I have to admit but some of it came out cold and not what was expected.  My husband and I each had a bowl of soup and we split a sandwich along with a mixed drink each.  The bill was almost $60.  NEVER AGAIN!

data.title: Great food , Great fun
data.text:
Fun atmosphere. Very casual. Excellent beer menu to pair with a wonderful selection of food. We had the Bretzels with Cinnamon and Sugar for an appetizer. Delicious!!!

For the meal we had chicken sandwiches, burgers and salmon sandwich. Everything was delicious and the service was great.

Ok place for kids earlier in the day but at night more of an adult crowd.

data.title: Amazing!!!
data.text: Highly recommend burger with cheddar, bacon, Mac and cheese and jalapeño!!! The best burger ever!!!! Cheese curds with ranch, hangover burger with fries, Reuben sandwich best anywhere!!! The beer is fantastic,  suggest the hefferitta, bloody Mary and BLONDE!! Greatest bartenders and service, definitely try it out!!!

data.title: Good Beer, Good Food
data.text: Stopped in here to eat during the annual Appleton Octoberfest. Our meals were awesome and the beers were very good. Menu is simple and suggests what type of beer to drink with your meal. Nice atmosphere, too

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: This place is fantastic. The food is amazing, I suggest trying the salmon sandwich, and the service is even more amazing. The renovation to this building makes it cool and comfortable. Great place to go with friends!

data.title: Great place
data.text: We had a sampler and left with a growler!. Service and atmosphere were great. The macaroni and cheese was probably the best I've had.

data.title: Great place to eat even traveling solo
data.text: The atmosphere was nice, spacious but had tables that seated single guests. The captures chicken sandwich was very good and the beer drink that has tequila and margarita mix was good as well. Definitely would recommend.

data.title: YUM
data.text: Food, service and environment was fantastic.  Had the chicken caprese sandwich.  Great taste and perfectly prepared.  Prices were competitive.  Will be back.

data.title: Came upon this spot on a whim!
data.text: Not only did we almost drive by this spot, but we got there at a perfect time! The restaurant wasn't too busy, so our hungry tummies didn't have to wait too long! Didn't try the beer because we were on a budget, but did have it later and thought it was too die for!

data.title: A neat place to eat
data.text: I have ate here a few times and although I don't drink (my coworkers do) the food is good and not your typical bar food. My coworkers always rave about the craft beers here as well.

data.title: Local Craft Beer Hotspot
data.text:
My wife and I ended up here twice over the weekend during Mile of Music. Great locally made craft beer. We enjoyed a few different pints, including their fresh Oktoberfest option. Everything was tasty and not very expensive. On our second visit we were looking for a day-drinking starter so we had a Bloody Mary and an Old Fashioned. Both were well-made and tasty though I should have went for the beer again as that was great.

Atmosphere was fun... lots of stone/brick, brewing tanks, and wood trims. The staff was cool and helpful for navigating the beer selections.

Only negative I have is related to the food. We perused the lunch menu online and on their window.. decided the food sounded great for a lunch with friends. Only after my wife and I (who had arrived first) had ordered a beverage were we told the normal menu didn't apply due to Mile of Music. The menu they did have was pretty limited and heavy so we finished our drinks and went to another brewpub. Just make sure your customers know what they're getting into! 

Great place, great location, great option when your party wants a craft beer.

data.title: If you like home brewed beer then this is your place
data.text: I went there on a happy hour/early dinner event. The place is nice, big and clean. The food was good, though it did not blow up mi head. The star is the beer. As the restaurant name says, they make their own beer and I tried the sampler with 8 small glasses. I like all of them, especially the dark ones. Would not hesitate going there again if given the chance!

data.title: Great beer, great staff, great food
data.text: Well the title says almost everything.   Clean,  friendly,  and better beer than most places.   Try the pretzel plate,  they are fantastic.

data.title: I'll go again!
data.text: Parking was nearby the front door. The staff was welcoming. The service was prompt and the food deliciously tasty. The menu included what beer would compliment the meal. Prices reasonable.

data.title: Great food and even better beer.
data.text: We went here for a business dinner/drinks.  The beer is brewed in site and is awesome.  The food is higher end pub fare and was awesome.  We had apps before dinner and they were fantastic as well.  I'll go back again!

data.title: Awesome Ale & Excellent Food
data.text:
I love the story of the owners  and their hard work to make this establishment/dream come true. The repurposing of materials is great and the finished.priduct is beautiful.

Walking is is a very welcoming felling, warm colors, nice lighting and beautiful wood great one's senses. We took time to view the beer triangle and had a nice conversation with on of the brew masters. There is evident pride in the beer they craft. The room is 2 stories and beautiful.

We began with beer of course, APA with a great hop flavor and a great medium body wheat with a distinct hint of clove and banana, both were very good.

We had a delicious home made cup of the Sausage Spatzel soup. Excellent flower fresh carrots and the sausage was wonderful. We had to try the Pickled Egg and really enjoyed it. Served in a shot glass with got sauce on the xbottom and topped with a sprinkle of hops and a jalapeño. Give this a try!

Dinner was also very good. All was serve hot and fresh.  We had the Chicken Capers and Pub Reuben.

The chicken sandwich was excellent. It was serve on a cibatta bun with tomatoes, Wisconsin mozzarella, EVOO, and balsamic, making for an excellent blend of flavors. On the side was fresh made potato salad with a slight vinegar base and fresh dill. Excellent.

The Reuben was fantastic. The corned beef was flavorful, tender and moist. It came with braised red cabbage, Wisconsin Swiss and their home made 1000 Island dressing. A perfect blend of flavors. We chose the home made pub slaw and again really enjoyed it. 

Give this place a try and take time to look  around and appreciate the hard work that went into to making this a place to come back to many times for great beer, food and atmosphere.

data.title: Great Place to sample craft brews
data.text: We stooped by while out shopping and were very pleased when we stopped in and had the opportunity to sample some craft brews. After a brief period we also decided to eat dinner there as well. The beers were good and the menu had a good variety of food at reasonable prices. The portions were good as well.

data.title: Good beer and Good Food.
data.text: A nice place with good people serving the beer and the food.  The beer is really good as the brewers started as homebrewers.  A nice selection of beer and food to match.

data.title: Great environment.. and beer!
data.text: My husband and I went here for dinner on a Friday night, a little after 7 pm. Upon arrival, staff was quick to greet us and then let us pick where we wanted to sit which was great as we were able to snag a table by the window with a street view. We each tried 2 different beers with dinner and we were satisfied with the food. Prices seemed reasonable, the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was that our server was slow to check back when we were wanting to order our second drinks to go with the meal. We plan on coming back for sure as we loved the ambience, food, and of course the beer :)
